page.title: 12BY AIR FROM WHALSAY
page.content: The 500m rolled gravel airstrip at Skaw was made in 1969.It is used by {Loganair}who fly twin-engined Britain Norman Islander planes.The 10min. flight from Whalsay to Tingwall,on the Mainland near Lerwick,at present costs Â£7.50 and 8 passengers can be taken. A waiting room at Skaw was completed in 1984,built by the council.A garage houses fire and emergency equipment. Each time the plane lands{Dennis}and/ or{Mary Eunson}are on hand in case needed. There are flights each weekday, weather permitting,but the plane only lands on Whalsay if there is a passenger arriving or departing.The plane also flies to Unst,Fetlar, Skerries,Foula and Fair Isle.From Tingwall there are flights to Aberdeen and Edinburgh.The plane is also an air ambulance in emergency.
